title: Prosecutors Began Investigating Renee Good’s Killing. Washington Told Them to Stop.
summary: Federal prosecutors had a warrant to collect evidence from Ms. Good’s vehicle, but Trump administration leaders said to drop it. About a dozen prosecutors have departed, leaving the Minnesota U.S. attorney’s office in turmoil.

title: Why Trump’s Calls to ‘Nationalize’ Voting Have Raised Midterm Fears
summary: The president has escalated his language as his administration takes steps to involve itself more in election matters.

title: Hegseth Says Defense Department Will Cut Ties With Harvard
summary: Mr. Hegseth’s order appeared to target his alma mater, Harvard’s Kennedy School for public policy.

title: Trump Deletes Racist Video Portraying the Obamas as Apes
summary: The video clip that President Trump posted in a late-night flurry of social media activity caused an unusually strong and public outcry from members of his own party.

title: U.S. Judge Says Trump Cannot Halt Funding for Gateway Tunnel Project
summary: Nearly all of the work had stopped on Friday while negotiations continued in Washington and litigation played out in court.

title: Mexican Cartels Overwhelm Police With Ammunition Made for the U.S. Military
summary: Drug syndicates have used .50-caliber ammunition, produced at a plant owned by the U.S. Army and then smuggled across the border, in attacks on Mexican civilians and police.

title: Lindsey Vonn Aims to Become the Oldest Alpine Olympic Medalist, Despite Ruptured A.C.L.
summary: The 41-year-old American aims to complete her comeback by racing in the women’s Olympic downhill on Sunday despite rupturing her left A.C.L. a week ago.

title: Super Bowl Halftime Is the World’s Biggest Stage. He Designs It.
summary: From Prince’s giant symbol to Kendrick Lamar’s streetlamps, the set production designer Bruce Rodgers “makes the impossible possible.”

title: The 2026 Super Bowl Ads (So Far), Ranked
summary: Here is our critic’s survey of this year’s Super Bowl commercials, from best to worst to A.I.

title: Trump’s Obama Derangement Syndrome
summary: The president shows, once again, that he shouldn’t be anywhere near the Oval.

title: How Hard Is It to Rig an American Election, Really?
summary: The round table convenes to debate whether we need to worry about the midterms being free and fair.

title: Vanity Fair
summary: Behind the scenes at the Westminster Dog Show, the entrants were affectionate. Or at least they acted like it.

title: Smaller N.Y.C. Classes Will Cost Millions. Can Mamdani Pull It Off?
summary: Mayor Zohran Mamdani wants to make classes smaller across the largest U.S. school system. Like other parts of his agenda, it’s a costly task.

title: Russian Strikes Pummel Ukraine’s Power Grid
summary: The drone and missile bombardments were the latest attacks on Ukrainian energy infrastructure during a winter freeze, as peace talks have made little progress.

title: Japan Ocean-Mining Test Successfully Hauls Up Potentially Valuable Mud
summary: It’s the latest twist in the controversial global race to mine the deep sea for rare-earth elements and other valuable resources.

title: What’s Up With This Big Freeze? Some Scientists See Climate Change Link
summary: A warming Arctic can stretch the polar vortex, a high-altitude air ribbon, one says. The “wobble” can disrupt the jet stream, causing extreme cold in the East.
